backend/main.mo: Actor that includes MixinStorage to provide blob storage functionality.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report listing implemented features, related files, components, and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON-style mapping of frontend file paths to high-level summaries of their responsibilities.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS setup defining theme variables, dark mode values, and base styling.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point defining the root element and loading the main React script.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that renders the PortfolioPage.
frontend/src/components/portfolio/Certif: Renders certifications and training cards using resumeContent with hover effects and a professional development list.
frontend/src/components/portfolio/Contac: Builds a contact grid from resumeContent and displays interactive cards with icons and optional external links.
frontend/src/components/portfolio/Educat: Displays education entries with degree, institution, period, location, and optional detail bullets.
frontend/src/components/portfolio/Experi: Renders experience cards with title, company, dates, location, and bullet-point responsibilities.
frontend/src/components/portfolio/Footer: Renders the site footer with copyright text, a caffeine.ai credit, and social links pulled from resumeContent.
frontend/src/components/portfolio/HeroSe: Displays the hero area with name, title, summary, badges, and buttons including smooth-scroll contact and resume download.
frontend/src/components/portfolio/Highli: Shows a grid of highlight cards summarizing key stats like practices managed, specialization, experience, and tech skills.
frontend/src/components/portfolio/Langua: Presents a languages section using resumeContent.languages with proficiency badges and a cultural competency note.
frontend/src/components/portfolio/Projec: Renders a list of technical projects with descriptions, bullets, tech badges, and optional GitHub or live links.
frontend/src/components/portfolio/RcmPor: Displays RCM case studies and sections using rcmCaseStudies and rcmSections with tools, responsibilities, and impact lists.
frontend/src/components/portfolio/Resume: Provides a button that checks resume availability and downloads the PDF via a blob-based fetch flow.
frontend/src/components/portfolio/Sectio: A layout wrapper that renders a titled section with consistent padding and container structure.
frontend/src/components/portfolio/Skills: Shows categorized skills from resumeContent with badges and descriptive headers plus a continuous-learning note.
frontend/src/components/portfolio/TopNav: Responsive navigation bar with desktop links, mobile sheet menu, and smooth scrolling behavior.
frontend/src/content/rcmPortfolioContent: Defines RCM case study data and interfaces for displaying project details and sections.
frontend/src/content/resumeContent.ts: Provides typed resume content including experience, projects, skills, education, and contact info.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages a backend actor tied to Internet Identity, refreshing queries when identity changes.
Checks whether a remote asset (PDF) exists using HEAD or fallback GET requests.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Implements Internet Identity auth context with login, logout, and identity persistence.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Empty placeholder since the portfolio uses only static content.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind setup with custom CSS variables and global theming for light/dark modes.
frontend/src/main.tsx: App entry point initializing React, query client, and Internet Identity provider.
frontend/src/pages/PortfolioPage.tsx: Composes all portfolio layout sections into a full-page structure.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS config enabling dark mode, custom colors, typography, container queries, animations, and extended theme settings. It sets content paths, fonts, color variables, shadows, and accordion animations.
project_state.json: JSON describing project state, including resumeâ€‘site update requirements, known issues, existing features, and pending feature requests for experience and project entries.
